body.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 leaps forward with faster, simpler, and more secure data processing. Take a look at What's new? for a list of new features and improvements that are available in this Developer Preview release. The developer preview version of Couchbase Server 4.5 is intended for development purposes only. We consider developer preview releases to have some rough edges and bugs, and may change significantly before the final GA release. The preview release is not supported in production.

section.title: Upgrade
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview (DP) is an early developer milestone update and requires a fresh install.
Upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server is not supported.

section.title: Behavior changes
section.p: These are the latest changes you will find in Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview:

ul.li: Disabling scientific notation for integers. With this change, large integers are no longer displayed in the scientific notation in N1QL. Details for the change can be found in MB-14720.

PENDING index state is now represented as DEFERRED and BUILDING. With this change, global indexes no longer display a PENDING state under status in SYSTEM:INDEXES. Instead, global indexes that are actively being built display BUILDING and global indexes that are created with the DEFER_BUILD option display DEFERRED for status attribute in the SYSTEM:INDEXES output in N1QL. Details for the change can be found in MB-14679.

The new backup tool is not backward compatible with older backup files from previous releases.
If you want to take a backup of a previous release and then load and restore it in Couchbase 4.5, you should use the cbbackup tool (not the new backup tool). After you restore the data into 4.5, you can start using the new backup tool for subsequent backup/restore operations to other 4.5 nodes.

section.title: Limitations
section.p:
Here are the limitations you will encounter when using Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview:
Full Text Search (FTS) is only supported on a single node in a cluster. You can have multiple nodes in the cluster, but only one node can run the FTS service. You are not prevented from starting the FTS service on multiple nodes. However, if you do, you may encounter unpredictable behavior.
FTS won’t have the following options: rebalance, failover or rollback.
Experimental FTS API support is available in Java 2.2.4 beginning February 17, 2016. Experimental FTS API support begins with the following SDK versions as of April 5, 2016: Python 2.0.9, GO 1.06, NET 2.2.7, and Node.js 2.1.5.
There is no authorization in place for any FTS operation.
Only the role of full administrator is implemented in this preview. Administrators will have to log into Couchbase using full administrator credentials to manage the cluster.
Sub-document API: Experimental subdocument API Support is available beginning with GO 1.04, and in libcouchbase (C) 2.5.6 as of February 17, 2016. Experimental subdocument API support begins as of March 1, 2016, with the following SDK versions: Python 2.0.8, Java 2.2.5, NET 2.2.6, and Node.js 2.1.4.
Results of query monitoring will only be available in CBQ ( Anil - Does it mean results are shown in old CBQ, REST)?
The Couchbase Web Console does not display the Query tab if the query node is not installed and running. (Anil to confirm – Does this tab show up in web console if not a query node? Does this tab show links to other nodes in the cluster that are running the query service? )
The Finegrain Array Indexing feature has these limitations:
Supports only ARRAY, DISTINCT, IN, and WITHIN operators.
Does not support covering indexes.
Does not maintain duplicate elements of an array or the position of elements within an array, and hence does not support expressions reconstructing the full array, or address the elements by position.
Memory Optimized Indexes is a cluster-wide setting and currently cannot coexist with other types of GSI indexes such as Forestdb.
Memory Optimized Indexes MUST completely fit in memory. Mutations will not get propagated to the indexes in case of Out-of-memory errors.
During installation, you can choose between ForestDB or Memory Optimized Indexes to manage Global Secondary Indexes. This setting cannot be changed post installation; to change this setting you would have to re-instal Couchbase. Changing the optimization mode of global indexes is not supported when index service nodes are present in the cluster. Please remove all index service nodes to change this option.

row.entry: FTS: No indexing activity noted for 60 seconds.
FTS: Unable to create more than 10 indexes.
Removing a document with a correct CAS fails after removal was tried with a wrong CAS.
Memcached was not terminated properly during Couchbase Server shutdown.
SCRAM-SHA512 and SCRAM-SHA256 do not apply for OSX.
N1QL: Array Indexing - Indexing meta().id with an array gives an incorrect result for the select meta fields.
Spatial views are broken after rebalance.
UI: Indexer storage option is frozen to global for the first indexer node after setting indexer storage to memory-optimised.
When adding a node to a cluster, add-node does not correctly deploy the selected services.
Flush operation failed for the sample travel bucket.

section.title: Deprecated functionality
section.p: The following functionality is deprecated, will be deprecated or is unsupported.

row.entry:
The BASE64() function is deprecated in this release; use the function BASE64_ENCODE() instead.
Also, use the BASE64_DECODE() function to reverse the encoding done by BASE64_ENCODE().
